p: In our previous report, we found that by changing Cu and Sn ratio in the Mg-Cu-Sn alloy, Cu-Sn alloys or composite with different phase compositions can be achieved via dealloying [ 28]. Herein, in this study, we applied the as-dealloyed Cu 6Sn 5 alloy and Cu 6Sn 5/Sn composite as the LIB anode. The as-dealloyed anode was found to have excellent cycling stability and rate performance due to the nanoporous structure. Moreover, the anode material has good thermal stability due to the formation of intermetallic Cu 6Sn 5, favoring the cycling. The ex situ XRD proved the reverse phase transformation between Cu 6Sn 5 and Li 2CuSn during charge/discharge process.
